Name: Plaza Antigua
Ingredients: 2 dash Peychaud's or other Creole-style bitters
Instructions: Select and pre-chill an Old-fashioned glass .
Prepare garnish of lemon zest twist.
EXPRESS lemon zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: The sweet herbal punch you'll recognise from the classic Vieux Carré but given extra life and fresh vitality by the addition of a shot of tequila (I've halved the usual doses of cognac and bourbon  to make way for the tequila). Plaza Antigua is Spanish for Old Square , while Vieux Carré is in turn French for Old Square hence I first tried using añejo tequila as the sole base spirit, but while good, this drink strayed too far away from what's recognisable as a Vieux Carré.
History: Created in February 2017 by yours truly (Simon Difford) at the Cabinet Room, London, England.
Nutrition: One serving of Plaza Antigua contains 208 calories
